title: Chinese Embassy Donated Office Equipment to the Young Women's Christian Association of Grenada
description: On October 28, 2014, Chinese Embassy in Grenada, represented by Ambassador Ou Boqian, donated office supplies (including a Lenovo computer) to the Young Women's Christian Association (YWCA) of Grenada.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description
On October 28, 2014, Chinese Embassy in Grenada, represented by Ambassador Ou Boqian, donated office supplies (including a Lenovo computer) to the Young Women's Christian Association (YWCA) of Grenada.
justification: Project involves donation of office equipment to a social organization with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of office supplies to Young Women's Christian Association, social development focus

title: 10 Recipients for 2014 China-Grenada Annual Scholarship Awards (linked to #54959, #54958)
description: On August 8th, 2014, Grenada's Ministry of Education held the award ceremony of the China-aided 2014 Grenada Annual Scholarship Awards. Ten Grenadian students received the scholarship and the opportunity to study in China. Chinese Ambassador Ou Boqian attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: This project is linked to Projects #54959 and #54958, detailing the awardees of 2015 and 2016.

evidence: Education sector, scholarship awards for students

title: Anhui Province of China Donated Sports Equipment to Grenada in 2014
description: On July 31, 2014, Anhui Province of China donated sports equipment and exchanged letters on sports cooperation with the Ministry of Youth, Sports, Culture, and the Arts of Grenada. Several government officials, including Chinese Ambassador Ou Boquian, Grenada Sports Minister Pierre, and Anhui Province Vice Governor Zie Guangxiang attended the ceremony and signing of the document for handing over the donation.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Anhui Province of China Donated Sports Equipment to Grenada in 2014

# Description
On July 31, 2014, Anhui Province of China donated sports equipment and exchanged letters on sports cooperation with the Ministry of Youth, Sports, Culture, and the Arts of Grenada. Several government officials, including Chinese Ambassador Ou Boquian, Grenada Sports Minister Pierre, and Anhui Province Vice Governor Zie Guangxiang attended the ceremony and signing of the document for handing over the donation.
justification: Project involves donation of sports equipment and cultural exchange, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Sports equipment donation, cultural exchange agreement, social development focus

title: Chinese Government provides a $193,000 USD grant for Phase I of the Grenada Low Income Housing Project - 2014 Disbursement (Linked to Project ID#69356)
description: In 2005, when Grenada re-established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China, the Chinese Government and the Government of Grenada signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) for the Grenada Low Income Housing Project. The Grenada Low Income Housing Project included the construction of 2,000 low income housing units. The project was intended to address the lack of housing in Grenada after the destruction the island's housing sector experienced during Hurricane Ivan in 2004.  The Chinese Government provided several grants to the Government of Grenada for the first phase. In total, it provided $11,193,000 USD. In 2014, it provided $193,000 USD, as captured by this project. The umbrella project for the Phase I of the Grenada Low Income Housing Project is captured by linked project ID#69356.  Beijing Construction Engineering Group Co., Ltd. (BCEG) was the contractor responsible for project implementation, while China International Engineering Design & Consult Co., Ltd. (CIEDC) was the contractor responsible for project design and the Xinjiang Institute of Building was the contractor responsible for project supervision. The first phase of the project included the construction of 361 units. Construction was set to begin in 2009. The project held a groundbreaking ceremony on November 27, 2009 that was attended by Prime Minister of Grenada Tillman Thomas.  The 353 units of the first phase were handed over to the Government of Grenada on August 24, 2012, but these units were incomplete because the Government of Grenada at the time was unable to provide the counterpart funding required to supply the units with electricity, water and sewage facilities. Additional work began on February 12, 2014 and was expected to be done within 6 months. The additional work was completed in September 2014. A housing distribution ceremony was held by the Government of Grenada on May 20, 2015.  Of the 361 units in the first phase, there were 181 units at Mt. Gay, 28 units at Frequente, and 158 units at Soubise. The total cost of the project -- which included financing from the Government of Grenada -- was $35 million XCD. Soubise is located in St. Andrew’s, while Mt. Gay and Frequente are located St. George’s.
staff_comments: This project is also known as the Chinese Housing Programme Phase 1. The Chinese project title is 我援格低收入住房项目（一期).On April 12, 2013, the Chinese Government and the Government of Grenada signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) related to the Grenada Low Income Housing Project (see 'Sino-Grenada Economic Technical Cooperation Agreement Signed'). This ETCA included the provision of a $1.33 million XCD grant from the Chinese Government to Grenada for the Grenada Low Income Housing Project, as captured by project ID#39677 (see 'China Providing $1.3 Million to Complete Grenada Housing Project'). This grant was not included a list of Chinese Government-financed projects provided to AidData by the Government of Grenada ('FUNDING - PRC - 2005 -2017'). The $193,000 USD in 2014 that is captured by this project cannot fully account the $1.33 million XCD, if it even is associated. To avoid duplicating disbursements, AidData has elected to leave the transaction amount of project ID#39677 blank until more information can be discovered.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides a $193,000 USD grant for Phase I of the Grenada Low Income Housing Project - 2014 Disbursement (Linked to Project ID#69356)

# Description
In 2005, when Grenada re-established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China, the Chinese Government and the Government of Grenada signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) for the Grenada Low Income Housing Project. The Grenada Low Income Housing Project included the construction of 2,000 low income housing units. The project was intended to address the lack of housing in Grenada after the destruction the island's housing sector experienced during Hurricane Ivan in 2004.  The Chinese Government provided several grants to the Government of Grenada for the first phase. In total, it provided $11,193,000 USD. In 2014, it provided $193,000 USD, as captured by this project. The umbrella project for the Phase I of the Grenada Low Income Housing Project is captured by linked project ID#69356.  Beijing Construction Engineering Group Co., Ltd. (BCEG) was the contractor responsible for project implementation, while China International Engineering Design & Consult Co., Ltd. (CIEDC) was the contractor responsible for project design and the Xinjiang Institute of Building was the contractor responsible for project supervision. The first phase of the project included the construction of 361 units. Construction was set to begin in 2009. The project held a groundbreaking ceremony on November 27, 2009 that was attended by Prime Minister of Grenada Tillman Thomas.  The 353 units of the first phase were handed over to the Government of Grenada on August 24, 2012, but these units were incomplete because the Government of Grenada at the time was unable to provide the counterpart funding required to supply the units with electricity, water and sewage facilities. Additional work began on February 12, 2014 and was expected to be done within 6 months. The additional work was completed in September 2014. A housing distribution ceremony was held by the Government of Grenada on May 20, 2015.  Of the 361 units in the first phase, there were 181 units at Mt. Gay, 28 units at Frequente, and 158 units at Soubise. The total cost of the project -- which included financing from the Government of Grenada -- was $35 million XCD. Soubise is located in St. Andrew’s, while Mt. Gay and Frequente are located St. George’s.
justification: Project focuses on social housing development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of 361 low income housing units, social development focus, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China Harbour Engineering Co., Ltd. donates a basketball court to the Bonair Government School (Linked to Project ID#54965 and #85814)
description: In March 2014, China Harbour Engineering Co., Ltd. (CHEC), the contractor responsible for St. Mark's Flood Mitigation Project, -- which was financed by a $5.1 million USD supplier's credit loan from CHEC (see linked project ID#54965) -- announced that it would donate a basketball court to the Bonair Government School. The school and the donated basketball court was located in the town of Victoria in Saint Mark Parish. CHEC had used a large section of the school's grounds as a project site during the implementation of the flood mitigation project. The basketball court was intended for the use of the students and wider community. CHEC also donated school supplies to the students of the school in March 2014 (see linked project ID#85814).  The completion ceremony of the St. Mark's Flood Mitigation Project, which was held on June 27, 2014, took place at the newly-built donated basketball court. The court was handed over the same day.
staff_comments: The Bonair Government School is sometimes referred to as the Bonaire Government School.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Government dispatches 24th medical team to Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital
description: The Chinese Government has sent the Republic of Guinea 26 medical teams since 1968. The 24th medical team consisted of 19 members from a hospital in Beijing. They were stationed at the Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital (Hôpital De L'amitié Sino-Guinéen), which is located in the Kipé district and the municipality of Ratoma. The team completed its term of service between August 16, 2014 and January 13, 2016. It formulated a comprehensive Ebola prevention and control training plan and trained nearly 1,700 Guinean staff.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 援几内亚第24批医疗队. The 24th medical team was the second Chinese medical team to be stationed at the Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital, which was constructed with grant funding from the Chinese Government (see Project ID#13330) and handed over to the local authorities on April 13, 2011.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 24th medical team to Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital

# Description
The Chinese Government has sent the Republic of Guinea 26 medical teams since 1968. The 24th medical team consisted of 19 members from a hospital in Beijing. They were stationed at the Sino-Guinean Friendship Hospital (Hôpital De L'amitié Sino-Guinéen), which is located in the Kipé district and the municipality of Ratoma. The team completed its term of service between August 16, 2014 and January 13, 2016. It formulated a comprehensive Ebola prevention and control training plan and trained nearly 1,700 Guinean staff.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services and training, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team deployment, Ebola prevention training, healthcare services

title: Chinese Government dispatches 1st batch of public health experts to Guinea for Ebola response activities
description: On August 11, 2014, the first batch of Chinese public health experts were dispatched to Guinea to help combat Ebola. They were dispatched by China's National Health and Family Planning Commission. The three-person team returned to China on August 15, 2014. The Chinese Government dispatched four more batches of public health experts to Guinea over the course of 2014 (projects #85288, #64657, #64659, #64668)
staff_comments: Chinese name: 第一批中国援助几内亚公共卫生专家组
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 1st batch of public health experts to Guinea for Ebola response activities

# Description
On August 11, 2014, the first batch of Chinese public health experts were dispatched to Guinea to help combat Ebola. They were dispatched by China's National Health and Family Planning Commission. The three-person team returned to China on August 15, 2014. The Chinese Government dispatched four more batches of public health experts to Guinea over the course of 2014 (projects #85288, #64657, #64659, #64668)
justification: Project focuses on public health assistance without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Dispatch of public health experts for Ebola response, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Government donates 1st batch of emergency medical supplies worth RMB 1 million for Ebola response activities (Linked to #43867, #41544)
description: In April 2014, the Chinese Government decided to donate the first batch of emergency medical supplies worth 1 million RMB to the Government of Guinea following the Ebola outbreak in West Africa. This donation mainly included protective suits, disinfectants, and rescue-monitoring equipment. These goods were delivered in mid-May 2014.   Also in April 2014, the Chinese government made identical donations to Sierra Leone (project #43867), and Liberia (project #41544).
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government donates 1st batch of emergency medical supplies worth RMB 1 million for Ebola response activities (Linked to #43867, #41544)

# Description
In April 2014, the Chinese Government decided to donate the first batch of emergency medical supplies worth 1 million RMB to the Government of Guinea following the Ebola outbreak in West Africa. This donation mainly included protective suits, disinfectants, and rescue-monitoring equipment. These goods were delivered in mid-May 2014.   Also in April 2014, the Chinese government made identical donations to Sierra Leone (project #43867), and Liberia (project #41544).
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for emergency response, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Emergency medical supplies for Ebola response, including protective suits and disinfectants

title: Chinese Government provides $5 million USD grant to Guinea for Ebola response activities
description: On November 19, 2014, the Chinese Government and the Republic of Guinea signed a grant agreement worth $5 million USD to combat the Ebola epidemic. The agreement was signed in Conakry by Chinese ambassador to Guinea Bian Jianqiang and Guinea's International Cooperation Minister Moustapha Koutoubou Sanoh. The grant proceeds would be used to purchase of 20 ambulances, 100 motorcycles, beds, and protective equipment. It is unclear when these goods were delivered.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government provides $5 million USD grant to Guinea for Ebola response activities

# Description
On November 19, 2014, the Chinese Government and the Republic of Guinea signed a grant agreement worth $5 million USD to combat the Ebola epidemic. The agreement was signed in Conakry by Chinese ambassador to Guinea Bian Jianqiang and Guinea's International Cooperation Minister Moustapha Koutoubou Sanoh. The grant proceeds would be used to purchase of 20 ambulances, 100 motorcycles, beds, and protective equipment. It is unclear when these goods were delivered.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare and epidemic response without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Grant for Ebola response activities, purchase of ambulances, motorcycles, beds, and protective equipment
